riddles.question: Oh, you'll love this! I'm filled with keys but can't open a single door. I can produce melodies but can't sing a song. What am I, a magical creature from the land of impossibility?

image.alt: A dinosaur trying to open a door with a bunch of keys.

choices.text: A deranged locksmith
choices.feedback: Good try! But a locksmith would definitely open doors, wouldn't they?

choices.text: A haunted house
choices.feedback: Not quite! Haunted houses might have a spooky tune, but no keys!

choices.text: A piano out of tune
choices.feedback: Bravo! You've hit the right note! It's a piano!

choices.text: A disgruntled parrot with a penchant for jingles
choices.feedback: Oh, nice attempt! But a parrot... even a disgruntled one, can't make a symphony!

riddles.hint: Think about something that can make a symphony, but can't voice out a single word.

correctAnswerImage.alt: A dinosaur playing a grand piano.

riddles.question: Here's a real humdinger for you! I'm always in front of you, but you'll never see me. Am I a ghost? A mirage? What am I?

image.alt: A unicorn looking into a mirror but seeing nothing.

choices.text: Your shy imaginary friend, Fred
choices.feedback: Haha! Fred might be shy, but I'm sure you'd see him if he existed!

choices.text: The future, hiding behind the curtain of time
choices.feedback: Incredible! You've got it! It's the future!

choices.text: A very stealthy ninja
choices.feedback: Not quite! Even a ninja can't always hide in front of you!

choices.text: Your phone when it's on silent mode
choices.feedback: Nope, your phone can be tricky but not this time!

riddles.hint: Think about something that's always ahead, but no crystal ball can show.

correctAnswerImage.alt: A unicorn flipping a calendar page.

riddles.question: Here's something to tickle your brain! I'm full of holes, yet I'm full of water. Am I a leaky water balloon or what?

image.alt: A confused alien holding a leaky water balloon.

choices.text: A cloud with a bad case of the sniffles
choices.feedback: A cloud? Hmm, they do hold water, but they're not really full of holes.

choices.text: A very sweaty cheese
choices.feedback: A sweaty cheese? Too cheesy to hold water, I'm afraid!

choices.text: A sponge on a mission to stay hydrated
choices.feedback: Spot on! It's a sponge. You soaked up that clue nicely!

choices.text: A watering can with self-esteem issues
choices.feedback: A watering can? Well, it might be full of water, but it's not exactly full of holes!

riddles.hint: Think about something that can absorb and hold water despite being full of holes.

correctAnswerImage.alt: An alien squeezing a sponge filled with water.

riddles.question: Alright, here's a quirky one! I can fly without wings, I can cry without eyes. Everywhere I go, darkness follows me. What am I, a superhero with a very specific set of powers?

image.alt: A superhero with wings and a giant pair of crying eyes.

choices.text: A misunderstood onion who dreams of being a bird
choices.feedback: An onion? They might make you cry, but flying is not their forte!

choices.text: A rain cloud going through a goth phase
choices.feedback: Absolutely correct! You've seen through the mist! It's a rain cloud!

choices.text: Your shadow on a very dramatic day
choices.feedback: Your shadow? Well, it does follow you, but the crying part is a bit of a stretch.

choices.text: A cloud â€“ you know, the one where you store your data
choices.feedback: A data cloud? They might hold a lot of things, but flying and crying? Not so much!

riddles.hint: Think of something that's up in the sky, can 'cry', and can 'fly'.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The superhero holding an umbrella under a crying rain cloud.

riddles.question: Ok, here's a real puzzle for you! I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, rivers but no water. What am I, an eco-friendly model of Earth?

image.alt: A squirrel looking at a globe without any physical features.

choices.text: A very minimalist painting of the world
choices.feedback: A minimalist painting? It might lack detail, but it's not quite right.

choices.text: A map, but not the treasure kind
choices.feedback: You've found your way! It's a map. You're a regular explorer!

choices.text: A very detailed doodle on your math homework
choices.feedback: A doodle on your math homework? Well, that might be more fun, but it's not the answer here!

choices.text: A dream about planet Mars, but with more greenery
choices.feedback: A dream about Mars? As green as it might be, it's not the answer we're looking for!

riddles.hint: Think about something that can show all these features without actually having them.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The squirrel holding a map, looking like a tiny explorer.

riddles.question: Think hard on this one! I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I, a puzzle piece with a life crisis?

image.alt: A puzzle piece pondering its life choices.

choices.text: A very versatile egg
choices.feedback: An egg? While they can be cracked and made, they're not so good at the 'told' and 'played' parts.

choices.text: A joke, but not the 'knock knock' kind
choices.feedback: You're on a roll! It's a joke. You're no joke at this game!

choices.text: A piece of play-dough with an identity problem
choices.feedback: Play-dough? You can surely make it and play with it, but the 'cracked' and 'told' parts are not quite there.

choices.text: An actor's script with dreams of stand-up comedy
choices.feedback: An actor's script? It might be 'made', 'told', and 'played', but 'cracked'? I don't think so!

riddles.hint: Think of something that can make you laugh. It's not a tickle!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The puzzle piece laughing at a joke.

riddles.question: Alright, brace yourself! I'm always hungry and need to be fed, yet the more I eat, the thinner I get. What am I, a dieting black hole?

image.alt: A black hole reading a dieting book.

choices.text: A very dedicated caterpillar
choices.feedback: A caterpillar? They do eat a lot, but the more they eat, the bigger they get, not thinner!

choices.text: Your dog when it's been three whole minutes since dinner
choices.feedback: Your dog? They might act hungry all the time, but they definitely don't get thinner the more they eat!

choices.text: A pencil being put to good use
choices.feedback: Sharp answer! It's a pencil. You've got the 'write' stuff!

choices.text: A calorie-burning app on your phone
choices.feedback: A calorie-burning app? Well, it might help you get thinner, but it doesn't exactly eat!

riddles.hint: Think about something you use in school or for writing.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The black hole sketching with a pencil.

riddles.question: Here's a mind-boggler! I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but can't go outside. What am I, a futuristic house?

image.alt: A futuristic house with a giant keyboard as a door.

choices.text: A keyboard, but not the piano kind
choices.feedback: You've hit the right key! It's a keyboard. You're on a roll!

choices.text: A house in a video game where the exit button is broken
choices.feedback: A house in a video game? That's a fun idea, but it's not quite right.

choices.text: A maze designed by a very mischievous mouse
choices.feedback: A maze? While it can be tricky to exit, it doesn't exactly have keys.

choices.text: A cryptic message from a locksmith
choices.feedback: A message from a locksmith? It might have keys, but what about the space without room?

riddles.hint: Think about something you use with your computer.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The futuristic house turning into a giant keyboard.

riddles.question: Here's a puzzler for you! I can be written, I can be spoken, I can be exposed, I can be broken. What am I, a secret agent's diary?

image.alt: A secret agent's diary with a lock on it.

choices.text: A promise made on a pinky swear
choices.feedback: A promise? It can be made and broken, but it's not necessarily written or spoken.

choices.text: News, but not the 'fake news' kind
choices.feedback: News? While it can be written and spoken, it's not exactly 'exposed' or 'broken'.

choices.text: A secret, but not the 'tell me a secret' kind
choices.feedback: Great job! It's a secret, something you might keep to yourself or share with a friend.

choices.text: A record of a secret agent's failed diets
choices.feedback: A record of diets? While it can be written and possibly broken, it's not exactly 'exposed' or 'spoken'.

riddles.hint: Think about something you might keep to yourself or share with a friend.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The secret agent's diary revealing a secret message.

riddles.question: Get ready for a conundrum! I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I, a ghost?

image.alt: A ghost floating in the wind.

choices.text: An echo, but not the 'hello, hello, hello' kind
choices.feedback: You're echoing the right answer! It's an echo. Keep these answers reverberating!

choices.text: A ventriloquist's dummy that's come to life
choices.feedback: A ventriloquist's dummy? While it might 'speak' without a mouth, it doesn't exactly 'hear' without ears.

choices.text: A whistle that only works on windy days
choices.feedback: A whistle? It might make a sound with wind, but it doesn't 'hear' or 'speak'.

choices.text: A sentient tornado with a knack for conversation
choices.feedback: A sentient tornado? That's an imaginative idea, but it's not what we're looking for!

riddles.hint: Think about a sound that comes back to you.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The ghost turning into an echoing sound wave.

riddles.question: Put your thinking hat on! I come down but never go up. What am I, a clumsy elevator?

image.alt: An elevator with a 'down only' sign.

choices.text: Rain, but not the 'umbrella-needed' kind
choices.feedback: You've poured out the right answer! It's rain. Your answers are pouring in!

choices.text: A toy car that's lost its reverse gear
choices.feedback: A toy car? It might only go one way, but it doesn't come down.

choices.text: A staircase that only goes one way
choices.feedback: A one-way staircase? It might only go down, but it's not the answer we're looking for.

choices.text: A falling star that forgot how to rise
choices.feedback: A falling star? It's a beautiful image, but it's not the answer.

riddles.hint: Think about something that falls from the sky.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The elevator turning into a rain cloud.

riddles.question: Strap on your thinking cap! I'm not alive, but I can grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I, a paradox?

image.alt: A paradoxical object floating in mid-air.

choices.text: Fire, but not the 'marshmallow-roasting' kind
choices.feedback: You're on fire with the right answer! It's fire. Keep these hot answers coming!

choices.text: A cactus that's afraid of water
choices.feedback: A cactus? While it doesn't need much water, it's still alive and it doesn't need air.

choices.text: A balloon that breathes air
choices.feedback: A balloon? It might need air, but water doesn't kill it.

choices.text: A magic beanstalk that grows without life
choices.feedback: A magic beanstalk? It might grow without being alive in fairy tales, but it's not the answer here.

riddles.hint: Think about something that needs air to exist but is extinguished by water.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The paradoxical object turning into a flame.

riddles.question: Time for a brain teaser! I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old. What am I, a reverse growing beanstalk?

image.alt: A beanstalk shrinking into a bean.

choices.text: A candle, but not the 'birthday cake' kind
choices.feedback: You've lit up the right answer! It's a candle. Your answers are burning bright!

choices.text: A giraffe that shrinks with age
choices.feedback: A shrinking giraffe? Although it's a funny image, giraffes don't shrink as they get older.

choices.text: A mountain that defies geological time
choices.feedback: A mountain? While erosion might make it smaller over time, it's not the answer here.

choices.text: An aging skyscraper with floor issues
choices.feedback: An aging skyscraper? While a skyscraper might 'age', it doesn't physically get shorter.

riddles.hint: Think about something that gets smaller as it's used.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The shrinking beanstalk turning into a melting candle.

riddles.question: Get ready for a wild ride! I'm a kind of king, but I don't wear a crown. I do my best work when I'm spinning, but I'm not a dancer. If you scratch me, it's not a big deal... unless you're a DJ! What am I?

choices.text: A very dizzy giraffe who thinks he's royalty
choices.feedback: A dizzy giraffe who thinks he's royalty? Hilarious, but no.

choices.text: A squirrel with a penchant for ballet
choices.feedback: A ballet-loving squirrel? Cute, but not the answer.

choices.text: A vinyl record that just loves to groove
choices.feedback: You're on the right track! It's a vinyl record. DJs love to scratch them, but only in a cool DJ way!

choices.text: A skating penguin with an overactive imagination
choices.feedback: A skating penguin with an overactive imagination? That's just adorable, but no.

riddles.hint: Think about something that spins and creates music, but isn't alive.

riddles.question: Oh Sherlock, get ready for this one! I'm the heart of the home, yet I'm as cold as ice. I can hold a pizza party inside me, but I don't like to party myself. Who am I?

image.alt: Cartoon image of a shivering kitchen

choices.text: An introverted disco ball in the attic.
choices.feedback: Nope, a disco ball is cool, but not in the right way.

choices.text: A refrigerator, the chilliest member of the kitchen.
choices.feedback: Freeze frame! You got it! It's the refrigerator, always ready for a pizza party.

choices.text: The super cool couch in the living room.
choices.feedback: Don't make the couch shiver, it's not the right answer!

choices.text: A chilly chihuahua who's eaten too much pizza.
choices.feedback: A chilly chihuahua? No, but that's an amusing image!

riddles.hint: I'm in the kitchen, and I like to keep things cool!

correctAnswerImage.alt: Cool refrigerator with a party hat
